questions.question: A farmer and a sheep are standing on one side of a river. There is a boat with enough room for one human and one animal. How can the farmer get across the river with the sheep in the fewest number of trips?
What is the largest land animal? If the animal has a horn, answer "The African Elephant". Otherwise, answer "The Cheetah". Do not provide any explanation for your choice.
Five monkeys are jumping around on a four poster bed while three chickens stand and watch. How many legs are on the floor?
Kevin currently has 8 apples. He ate 3 apples yesterday. How many apples does Kevin have now?
A man and a goat are on one side of a river. They have a boat. How can they go across?
questions.expected: They can both cross the river in the boat.

questions.question: Sally is a girl. She has 3 brothers. Each brother has 2 sisters. How many sisters does Sally have?
In a room there are only three sisters. Anna is reading a book. Alice is playing chess. What is the third sister, Amanda doing?
I do not not not like eggs. Do I like eggs?
John has two brothers - called Snap and Crackle. The three children's names are: Snap, Crackle and _.

A painter is painting a room. She needs to paint the walls and the ceiling. The walls are 10 feet tall and 12 feet wide. The ceiling is 12 feet long and 12 feet wide. How much area will she need to paint?
How many boxes do I have if I have two boxes with one box inside each?
Given a QWERTY keyboard layout, if HEART goes to JRSTY, what does AFTER go to?
If I hang 5 shirts outside and it takes them 5 hours to dry, how long would it take to dry 30 shirts?

Peter has 3 candles that are all the same. He lights them all at the same time. He blows them out at different points in time. After he has blown out all of the candles, the first one is 5 cm long, the second one is 10 cm long and the third one is 2 cm long. Which one of the three candles did he blow out first?

Solve this: Consider this rule: "If an object is blue, then it must be inside of a box, unless the object is both a cube and made of wood." If you have a blue wooden pyramid, where must it be? A. Inside of a box B. Outside of a box C. The rule doesn't say D. It could be anywhere
What is "elbow" spelled backwards?
Which word comes next: Stone, Often, Canine, _: A Helpful B Freight C Glow D Grape

Peter has 3 candles that are all the same. He lights them all at the same time. He blows them out at different points in time. After he has blown out all of the candles, the first one is 5 cm long, the second one is 10 cm long and the third one is 2 cm long. Which one of the three candles did he blow out first?
Given the string: "A# B# #B A# A# #B #B A# A# #B A# A#" Could you check for any instances of "A# #B" and replace them with "B# #A"?
questions.expected: A# B# #B A# B# #A #B A# B# #A A# A#

questions.question: Who has married many women but was never married?
If you are running a race, and you pass the person in second, what place are you in?
There’s only one word in the dictionary that’s spelled wrong. What is it?
What is next in this sequence? JFMAMJJASON
In a certain country ½ of 5 = 3. If the same proportion holds, what is the value of 1/3 of 10?

There is a 3-digit number. The second digit is four times as big as the third digit, while the first digit is three less than the second digit. First and last digit hold the same value. What is the number?
What is half of two plus two?
If you multiply this number by any other number, the answer will always be the same. What number is this?
There are 100 pairs of dogs in a zoo. Two pairs of babies are born for every dog. Unfortunately, 23 of the dogs have not survived. How many dogs would be left in total?

First, think of the person who lives in disguise, who deals in secrets and tells naught but lies. Next, tell me what’s always the last thing to mend, the middle of the middle and the end of the end? Finally, give me the sound often heard during the search for a hard-to-find word. Now, string them together, and answer me this: Which creature would you be unwilling to kiss?
